title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 22 August 2014 - XWiki
content:

10:31 <Enygma`> has quit

10:56 <aroger> has joined #xwiki  
10:59 <Lyes2> has joined #xwiki  
11:00 <aroger> Hi,  
11:00 <aroger> Someone can give me access on nexus repositories ?  
11:00 <aroger> I have a Forbidden  
11:00 <aroger> Nexus returned an error: ERROR 403: Forbidden  
11:01 <vmassol> aroger: hi  
11:01 <vmassol> when you release with maven?  
11:01 <aroger> just now  
11:01 <vmassol> when you release with maven?  
11:01 <aroger> i only promoted on nexus (my bad)  
11:01 <vmassol> where do you get this error?  
11:02 <Lyes1> has quit  
11:02 <aroger> On nexus.xwiki.org  
11:02 <vmassol> don't promote!  
11:03 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:03 <vmassol> let me update the doc  
11:03 <aroger> ok  
11:06 <vmassol> aroger: http://contrib.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome?viewer=changes&rev2=59.1  
11:07 <aroger> Thanks for update  
11:07 <aroger> I already closed the repo, but I can't click on release  
11:07 <aroger> When I reload the page I have a pop-up with 403 Forbidden error  
11:15 <aroger> has quit  
11:16 <aroger> has joined #xwiki  
11:29 <vmassol> aroger: i've released it for you  
11:31 <aroger> vmassol: Ok thank you! :)  
11:52 <vmassol> FTR I'm trying to debug the platform build failure with teh quality profile  
11:52 <vmassol> http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Platform/job/xwiki-platform\_Quality\_Checks/2603/console  
11:55 <Enygma`> has quit  
11:57 <evalica> has quit  
11:59 <vmassol> something is definitely wrong  
12:10 <vmassol> ah I know  
12:11 <vmassol> hmmno  
12:16 <aroger> has quit  
12:18 <lulzme> has joined #xwiki  
12:21 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
12:24 <vmassol> I'm stuck….. :)  
12:24 <lulzme> has quit  
12:25 <Lyes2> has quit  
12:26 <polx> has quit  
12:28 <vmassol> ok I know! :)  
12:29 <vmassol> caused by sdumitriu indirectly  
12:29 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
12:36 <vmassol> actually it's complex to fix properly… need to think more  
12:36 <vmassol> lunch time ATM  
12:56 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Pong  
13:03 <vmassol> sdumitriu: see my last commit  
13:03 <vmassol> this was causing some CI build failures  
13:03 <vmassol> took me a while to figure this out ;)  
13:04 <vmassol> as I said in my commit, I'd like to reproduce the problem you were fixing to see if there's something else we can do about it  
13:05 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
13:16 <sdumitriu> It always show a warning when building platform  
13:16 <sdumitriu> First lines  
13:39 <vmassol> sdumitriu: I tried and it doesn't for me. I tried with xwiki-rendering  
13:39 <vmassol> https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/763629b789bd70a191e0/raw/bf809415217f8574870f4fb54e3119c4e30a2285/gistfile1.txt  
13:39 <vmassol> (same for platform)  
14:27 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
14:28 <Denis> has quit  
14:44 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
14:56 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:15 <polx> has quit  
15:25 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:42 <polx> has quit  
15:43 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
15:43 <polx> has quit  
15:47 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
15:48 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
15:49 <Lyes> has quit  
15:51 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
15:54 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
16:13 <vmassol> guys does it work for you to execute functional tests for , say, the faq app?  
16:13 <vmassol> it fails for me with:  
16:13 <vmassol> [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin:6.2-SNAPSHOT:package (default) on project xwiki-platform-faq-test-tests: Execution default of goal org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin:6.2-SNAPSHOT:package failed: A required class was missing while executing org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-tool-packager-plugin:6.2-SNAPSHOT:package: Failed to get fields for class [com.xpn.xwiki.inte  
16:14 <vmassol> I have no clue why especially since the rendering api is in the exeucting CL  
16:32 <vmassol> weird removing rendering from my local repo fixed it....  
16:39 <msmeria> has quit  
16:40 <Denis> has quit  
17:09 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Looked at the Jenkins error, that's actually showing that my change was good  
17:10 <sdumitriu> vmassol: What happens is that the Jenkins Agent has an old version of the commons repository  
17:10 <vmassol> no  
17:10 <sdumitriu> Probably since commons wasn't built on that agent in a long time  
17:10 <sdumitriu> And it find an ancient version of the POM there  
17:10 <vmassol> I've explained the problem in my commit  
17:10 <vmassol> in comment  
17:11 <vmassol> and not it's not good  
17:11 <vmassol> 100% sure  
17:11 <vmassol> :)  
17:11 <vmassol> s/and not/and no  
17:11 <sdumitriu> It is good  
17:11 <vmassol> can you check my comment in pom.xml please  
17:11 <sdumitriu> It's just having side effects  
17:11 <sdumitriu> Yes  
17:11 <vmassol> I've explained in details  
17:11 <sdumitriu> That's exactly what I'm saying  
17:11 <vmassol> (I tried)  
17:11 <sdumitriu> It has an old version of commons  
17:11 <vmassol> side effect is not a good thing  
17:11 <vmassol> :)  
17:11 <vmassol> obviously  
17:11 <sdumitriu> The issue isn't that it's wrong to point to the parent project  
17:12 <sdumitriu> But that Jenkins shouldn't have repos like that  
17:12 <vmassol> first, it's wrong to assume a certain layout  
17:12 <vmassol> especially when using /..  
17:12 <sdumitriu> That's an invisible dependency between workspaces  
17:12 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Ah, I know how I get that error  
17:12 <vmassol> second, as I mentioned I cannot reproduce your warning issue  
17:13 <sdumitriu> I have a different pom.xml in the parent folder  
17:13 <momomomomo> has quit  
17:13 <sdumitriu> vmassol: It's not wrong to assume a certain layout  
17:13 <vmassol> with ../ I think it is  
17:13 <vmassol> epecially in maven  
17:14 <vmassol> as there's no notion of workspace yet  
17:14 <sdumitriu> But there already is a certain layout assumed  
17:14 <vmassol> inside a projet yes  
17:14 <vmassol> inside a reactor project that is  
17:14 <sdumitriu> By default Maven assumes that the parent is in the parent directory  
17:14 <sdumitriu> No, not a reactor project, any project  
17:15 <vmassol> yes I know, but your change makes it even more likely to cause some problem  
17:15 <vmassol> actually  
17:15 <sdumitriu> Try it: change xwiki-commons/pom.xml, don't build it, and build a descendant module  
17:15 <vmassol> we should use a relativepath that cannot exist  
17:15 <sdumitriu> It will see the changes  
17:15 <sdumitriu> Even if the pom is not installed  
17:15 <vmassol> I know how maven works sdumitriu :)  
17:16 <sdumitriu> Because of the implicit parent path I get that error, so if we define an explicit path that doesn't exist, nothing wrong happens  
17:16 <sdumitriu> It will just be silently ignored as before  
17:16 <sdumitriu> vmassol: To make something clear, I'm not arguing for restoring my commit, just arguing that your motivation is invalid  
17:16 <vmassol> my motivation cannot be wrong :)  
17:16 <sdumitriu> There is a bug in Jenkins, and as a workaround your fix is good at the moment  
17:16 <vmassol> it fixed the CI  
17:17 <vmassol> :)  
17:17 <vmassol> that's my mtovation  
17:17 <sdumitriu> K, not motivation, reasoning  
17:17 <vmassol> what I know is that my 'fix" isn't perfect  
17:17 <vmassol> but as you said there's no good solution  
17:17 <vmassol> except maybe the invalid path , I need to try that  
17:18 <vmassol> need to check if maven still checks the parent in case of an invalid relativepath  
17:18 <sdumitriu> I think that looking for a parent is a new feature in Maven3, I kind of remember that it didn't read parents from the filesystem a long time ago  
17:18 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
17:18 <sdumitriu> But I might be wrong  
17:19 <vmassol> looking for parent has always been there  
17:19 <sdumitriu> Even if the parent is not in the reactor?  
17:19 <vmassol> that I don't know  
17:19 <sdumitriu> It should look for the parent in repos  
17:19 <vmassol> yes  
17:20 <sdumitriu> But I know that a long time ago I had to install changed parent poms before building children  
17:20 <vmassol> between top level repos yes  
17:20 <vmassol> because they're not in parent-child relationship  
17:20 <vmassol> but inside a top level project it has always worked fine for me  
17:22 <sdumitriu> Even in 2007?  
17:22 <vmassol> as far back as I've used maven  
17:22 <sdumitriu> With the right relativePath, it will work cross-repo as well  
17:22 <sdumitriu> OK  
17:22 <vmassol> even m1  
17:22 <vmassol> but my memory may be failing me  
17:22 <sdumitriu> By the way, Jenkins doesn't load for me  
17:23 <vmassol> yes it depends  
17:23 <vmassol> sometimes it's very fast sometimes our apache front end times out  
17:23 <vmassol> I think it always succeeds but our front times out when it's too long  
17:23 <vmassol> (ie above 30 seconds or so)  
17:24 <Pbas> has left #xwiki  
17:24 <vmassol> sdumitriu: just to be clear  
17:24 <vmassol> the warning you were getting before  
17:24 <vmassol> (before your commit)  
17:25 <vmassol> was due to you having some wrong pom.xml in a directory above your top level repos directories?  
17:25 <vmassol> ie above xwiki-commons, xwiki-rendering, etc  
17:25 <sdumitriu> Yes  
17:25 <vmassol> ?  
17:25 <vmassol> ok  
17:26 <vmassol> someone suggested using an empty <relativePath></relativePath> in a jira issue  
17:26 <vmassol> https://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MNG-5146  
17:27 <vmassol> not sure about the side effects though  
17:27 <sdumitriu> Yes, that's the warning message I get  
17:27 <vmassol> http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6003831/parent-relativepath-points-at-my-com-mycompanymyproject-instead-of-org-apache  
17:28 <vmassol> http://stackoverflow.com/a/6006098  
17:28 <vmassol> actually it's docuimented  
17:28 <vmassol> http://maven.apache.org/ref/3.0.3/maven-model/maven.html#class\_parent  
17:28 <vmassol> "Set the value to an empty string in case you want to disable the feature and always resolve the parent POM from the repositories."  
17:28 <vmassol> cool  
17:28 <vmassol> maybe we should do that then  
17:29 <sdumitriu> Yep  
17:29 <sdumitriu> Sounds like the best option  
17:29 <vmassol> ok will try  
17:44 <KermitTheFragger> has quit

21:38 <xwikiorg\_guest\_7> With xwiki.authentication.ldap.bind\_DN=, is this asking for the container where the authenticated user resides that allows ldap querying ?
